items.title: Infrastructure Solutions Architect w/ Azure - REMOTE - 1797
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=24, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: Job Posting Title: Infrastructure ArchitectLocation: Alpharetta - preferred or REMOTE (East Coast)Looking for an infrastructure solution architect with deep knowledge of Microsoft Azure (IaaS, PaaS and SaaS) Experience delivering infrastructure architectures for Azure-hosted enterprise-scale solutions Strong communication and consulting skills8+ years of experience working as a solutions architectExperience with Dell Boomi is a nice-to-have, but not a hard requirement given this is somewhat of a niche skillset.Ideally they're based in Alpharetta, GA, but we're open to candidates in other locations- preferably on the east coast/Remote--Position SummaryThe solution architect is a "thought-leader" and a "change agent" with strategic and tactical responsibilities.A Solution Architect is responsible for delivering solution designs and architectures for key global initiatives using COTS, MOTS and custom developed applications hosted in a variety of environments considering re-use, scalability and reliability. Oversees and sometimes leads the successful implementation of these designs and architectures by managing expectations and risks, ensuring appropriate organizational structures, principles, tools and responsibilities are in place Evaluates solutions to ensure that they are in alignment with the broader organization's mission, strategy / objectives, capabilities and processes using industry recognized architectural models and roadmaps Creates reliable solution plans that include cost estimates and optimized delivery approaches by working with the business and multi-disciplinary teams, enforcing governance and compliance activities for the solution Acts as a bridge between technical and business audiences during solution planning, development and deployment Works with the business to understand and solve complex problems, by presenting various solution options and technical concepts in a comprehensible manner.Experience/Required Skills: To qualify, candidates must have:Approximately 8-10 years of experience in information systems architecture methodologies, management, and tracking/analyzing budgetsExtensive knowledge of systems architectureExcellent management, interpersonal, communication, consultative, and organizational skillsSound judgment and tactStrong analytical abilityThe ability to work and team effectively with clients, management, and its staff membersOperating Systems - Experience in designing on MS Windows Server technologies , Unix, Linux and virtualization (VMWare)4-6yrs Databases - Experience in designing infrastructure for databases, e.g., high availability, D/R solutions around databases Oracle, MS SQL etc 4-6yrsSystems Management - Knowledge of enterprise class network and server management solutions such as HP Openview. 4-6yrs Internet Technologies - Web servers (IIS, Apache), Proxy servers, Load balancers, Global site selector, Firewalls, Certificate, SSO (Kerberos, ADFS, CA SiteMinder) etc. 4-6yrsDirectory Services - LDAP/AD/ADAM] 4-6yrsApplication servers - Tomcat, Websphere, Weblogic, Peoplesoft, Exchange, Lync, Microsoft Sharepoint, eRoom etc 4-6yrsNetwork and Security -Knowledge of enterprise class LAN (Office LAN, Data Center LAN), WAN, VPN and network security (IPSec, Firewalls, DMZ).General awareness of information security. 4-6yrsHardware - Basic knowledge of Dell and HP rack mounted servers, blades, HPUX, Superdome etc 4-6yrsStorage and Backup - Experience in designing solutions for managing enterprise class storage network solutions around technologies like SAN, NAS, Encrypting file system and products like EMC and NetApp storage devices.4-6yrs Capacity and performance - Experience in designing infrastructure to meet the performance requirements of the application based on the data collected from the legacy system and model for the future grow.Knowledge of the performance measurement diagram and utilities4-6yrsEducation: A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline, or equivalent work experience

items.title: Remote - Adobe Presales / Solution Architect
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
"NO THIRD PARTIES PLEASE!" DIRECT CANDIDATES ONLY! THIS IS A REMOTE, HOME-BASED OPPORTUNITY. CANDIDATES MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL AS NEEDED UP TO 50%. MULTIPLE OPENINGS AVAILABLE! *** This role is bonus eligible position with outstanding benefits - 401k matching, medical, dental, vision and more!*** Required Skills Technical knowledge of at least 2 Adobe Experience Cloud solutions ( AEM, Campaign, Target, Analytics, Audience Manager, Ad Cloud) Understanding of how to position each Experience Cloud solution for a client Positive, business-oriented mindset, focused on winning business by making clients successful Ability to gain a client s trust as an advocate for their success Ability to gain our sales team s trust as an advocate for Adobe Experience Cloud solutions and corresponding Sirius services Bonus for previous presales experience - opportunity identification through signature and project onboarding Bonus for being able to position other company services and products beyond Adobe(cross-sell): Conversational AI/Chatbots, Data services (data governance, data warehouse creation, etc.), Microsoft Azure consumption, Creative design, digital strategy, integration, custom development and native mobile apps, SEO, etc. Role Description Networking & Opportunity Identification Adobe Networking Network with Named Account Managers within a geography Network with Adobe solution specialists Build a solid relationship with aligned Adobe Partner Sales Managers Sponsor at least one Adobe QBR during the year Sponsor at least one meal at Adobe Sales Kickoff or Summit with your assigned Adobe geo / segment Internal Networking Perform one internal onboarding and account mapping session within your geo and invite Adobe to participate Marketing Conduct at least two marketing events per year with your Adobe geo / segment, coordinated with the local corporate team. This event should be conducted with the internal Marketing team and participation with Adobe Marketing as well. A webinar, point of view paper, or similar activity will suffice as well. Hold at least 4 specific client meetings at Adobe Summit Opportunity Qualification and Evangelism Have initial or second conversations with clients to understand the total breadth of the opportunity. Opportunities that may come in as a solution-specific opportunity may in fact have more broad business needs that have not been addressed. Software: Deal Registration & Resell Work with sellers to submit a deal registration and accompanying Proof of Influence Services: Partner with Adobe and internal account team to position Adobe solutions paired with internal implementation services Where needed, perform demos of Adobe solutions Be able to talk to and advocate for solutions and services across all Experience Cloud solutions Position adjacent services across Data, AI, Microsoft, Creative design, SEO, and Ad Spend management For many accounts, client will propose a MarTech Assessment as the first phase and there is a well-defined methodology to execute that assessment. Participate and/or lead that assessment, which ultimately culminates in a MarTech roadmap for the customer and a proposal for the first phase of capabilities / solutions / services. Scope and Forecast Software For rebate / deal reg opportunities, ensure the deal reg has been approved and all POI has been attached. Services Scope and estimate implementation services. Bring in team leads as necessary to validate scope and estimates, but primary responsibility for estimates is on the Adobe TA. Make sure Adobe Launch Foundation Services are included in the quote as well (ideally on the SOW). Write Proposals and SOWs, get Deal Review Board approval, and deliver to the client. Make recommendations on staffing and transition the opportunity over to the Perform teams for delivery. Engage for the first week of services (billable) to help with kickoff and getting the project off on the right start. Work with the internal Client Exec to properly forecast each opportunity; align those forecasts with the Adobe NAM s forecast so our expected close date is the same as their expected close date. For each opportunity past Stage 5 in the Adobe lifecycle (Solution Definition and Validation), or anticipated services start date within 2 months, forecast the Services team and services start date in the Adobe Opportunity tracker. Provide Steps to Close visibility within Sirius and align the steps to close with the Adobe rep. Close and Transition Obtain signatures on software and services. Make recommendations on staffing and transition the opportunity over to the Perform teams for delivery. Engage for the first week of services (billable) to help with kickoff and getting the project off on the right start. Stay engaged outside of delivery for future Adobe opportunities, particularly if there is no Client Director, or senior Project Manager capable of promoting future work. There always needs to be a primary farmer on any account, and the default is the Adobe Presales Solution Architect. - provided by Dice

adobe, aem, campaign, target, analytics, audience manager, ad cloud, presales, solution architect, sales, Adobe cloud

items.content:
Sematext Group, Inc.

Elasticsearch Solutions Architect


Europe, Central and South America, Asia Pacific and Australia
Sematext is known for our deep Elasticsearch expertise. We've worked with Elasticsearch since version 0.x. Our team has written books about Elasticsearch, Solr, and Lucene and given numerous talks about them at conferences. We are looking to find Elasticsearch engineers to join our distributed team of Elasticsearch consultants. Note that this is **not** the sort of job where you work at the customer's office and live out of the suitcase in a hotel room. 99.9% of our work with customers is done remotely. See some of our [past customers](https://sematext.com/clients/) and what some of them had to say about Sematext. You will especially enjoy this position if you like being exposed to a wide variety of projects and Elasticsearch use-cases, if you like interacting with customers (email, chat, voice, or face to face), understanding their problems and requirements, designing and developing scalable, highly available, fault-tolerant systems for processing large volumes of data and queries. This position is also great for those who may not feel like true Elasticsearch experts today, but would like to work along Sematext’s experts and become true experts by learning from them, whether through collaboration or by joining [our Elasticsearch trainings](https://sematext.com/training/elasticsearch/). **Location** This position is open to candidates in Europe, Central and South America, Asia Pacific, and Australia, although truly exceptional individuals from other corners of the planet will be considered, too. **About Sematext** * We are a fully distributed, remote first (and only!) company * The whole team gathers once a year, each time in a different location * We are a team of industry veterans and senior engineers * We are well-known in the industry as Elasticsearch experts * We are fully bootstrapped **More info** Learn more about [Sematext Engineering](https://sematext.com/engineering/) and everything we do at [https://sematext.com/](https://sematext.com/). # Responsibilities * Design, implement, and troubleshoot solutions with Elasticsearch * Provide expert-level Elasticsearch consulting, development, and support services to a wide range of organizations * Observe and identify customer pain points, priorities, requirements, and success criteria * Resolve non-trivial search issues involving Elasticsearch, and related technologies # Requirements * Excellent oral and written English * Excellent communication skills * Strong Elasticsearch knowledge with desire to learn more #Location - Europe, Central and South America, Asia Pacific and Australia

items.content:
"NO THIRD PARTIES PLEASE!" DIRECT CANDIDATES ONLY!

THIS IS A REMOTE, HOME-BASED OPPORTUNITY. CANDIDATES MUST BE WILLING TO TRAVEL AS NEEDED UP TO 50%.

MULTIPLE OPENINGS AVAILABLE!

*** This role is bonus eligible position with outstanding benefits - 401k matching, medical, dental, vision and more!***

Required Skills

  • Technical knowledge of at least 2 Adobe Experience Cloud solutions (AEM, Campaign, Target, Analytics, Audience Manager, Ad Cloud)
  • Understanding of how to position each Experience Cloud solution for a client
  • Positive, business-oriented mindset, focused on winning business by making clients successful
  • Ability to gain a client s trust as an advocate for their success
  • Ability to gain our sales team s trust as an advocate for Adobe Experience Cloud solutions and corresponding Sirius services
  • Bonus for previous presales experience - opportunity identification through signature and project onboarding
  • Bonus for being able to position other company services and products beyond Adobe(cross-sell): Conversational AI/Chatbots, Data services (data governance, data warehouse creation, etc.), Microsoft Azure consumption, Creative design, digital strategy, integration, custom development and native mobile apps, SEO, etc.

Role Description

Networking & Opportunity Identification

  • Adobe Networking
    • Network with Named Account Managers within a geography
    • Network with Adobe solution specialists
    • Build a solid relationship with aligned Adobe Partner Sales Managers
    • Sponsor at least one Adobe QBR during the year
    • Sponsor at least one meal at Adobe Sales Kickoff or Summit with your assigned Adobe geo / segment
  • Internal Networking
    • Perform one internal onboarding and account mapping session within your geo and invite Adobe to participate
  • Marketing
    • Conduct at least two marketing events per year with your Adobe geo / segment, coordinated with the local corporate team. This event should be conducted with the internal Marketing team and participation with Adobe Marketing as well. A webinar, point of view paper, or similar activity will suffice as well.
    • Hold at least 4 specific client meetings at Adobe Summit

Opportunity Qualification and Evangelism

  • Have initial or second conversations with clients to understand the total breadth of the opportunity. Opportunities that may come in as a solution-specific opportunity may in fact have more broad business needs that have not been addressed.
  • Software: Deal Registration & Resell
  • Work with sellers to submit a deal registration and accompanying Proof of Influence
  • Services:
  • Partner with Adobe and internal account team to position Adobe solutions paired with internal implementation services
  • Where needed, perform demos of Adobe solutions
  • Be able to talk to and advocate for solutions and services across all Experience Cloud solutions
  • Position adjacent services across Data, AI, Microsoft, Creative design, SEO, and Ad Spend management
  • For many accounts, client will propose a MarTech Assessment as the first phase and there is a well-defined methodology to execute that assessment.
  • Participate and/or lead that assessment, which ultimately culminates in a MarTech roadmap for the customer and a proposal for the first phase of capabilities / solutions / services.

Scope and Forecast

  • Software
    • For rebate / deal reg opportunities, ensure the deal reg has been approved and all POI has been attached.
  • Services
    • Scope and estimate implementation services. Bring in team leads as necessary to validate scope and estimates, but primary responsibility for estimates is on the Adobe TA.
    • Make sure Adobe Launch Foundation Services are included in the quote as well (ideally on the SOW).
    • Write Proposals and SOWs, get Deal Review Board approval, and deliver to the client.
  • Make recommendations on staffing and transition the opportunity over to the Perform teams for delivery. Engage for the first week of services (billable) to help with kickoff and getting the project off on the right start.
  • Work with the internal Client Exec to properly forecast each opportunity; align those forecasts with the Adobe NAM s forecast so our expected close date is the same as their expected close date.
  • For each opportunity past Stage 5 in the Adobe lifecycle (Solution Definition and Validation), or anticipated services start date within 2 months, forecast the Services team and services start date in the Adobe Opportunity tracker.
  • Provide Steps to Close visibility within Sirius and align the steps to close with the Adobe rep.

Close and Transition

  • Obtain signatures on software and services.
  • Make recommendations on staffing and transition the opportunity over to the Perform teams for delivery. Engage for the first week of services (billable) to help with kickoff and getting the project off on the right start.
  • Stay engaged outside of delivery for future Adobe opportunities, particularly if there is no Client Director, or senior Project Manager capable of promoting future work. There always needs to be a primary farmer on any account, and the default is the Adobe Presales Solution Architect.

- provided by Dice

items.title: Senior Cloud Architect - Azure (virtual remote home office eligible)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Description

The Senior Cloud Architect leads the planning, design, and engineering of enterprise-level infrastructure and platforms related to cloud computing. The Senior Cloud Architect work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities

The Senior Cloud Architect performs technical planning, architecture development and modification of specifications for cloud computing environments. Develops specifications for new IT cloud computing products and service offerings. Assesses the compatibility and integration of products/services proposed as standards in order to ensure an integrated architecture across interdependent technologies. Begins to influence department's strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments.

We are seeking a Cloud Technical Architect with extensive experience working in a complex computing environment to join our internal Virtualization and Infrastructure team. As a Cloud Technical Architect, you will work as part of a team that designs and architects Humana's next generation internal and external cloud infrastructure. A thorough understanding of and working experience with an Enterprise computing infrastructure and cloud computing technologies are required. To be successful you will need a strong technical orientation; be a creative problem solver; be motivated to advance in the field; and work well in a team-oriented environment.

Job Responsibilities

  • Design, build and deploy Cloud solutions across Humana's Azure tenant
  • Design automation of infrastructure as a Service and capabilities including virtual networks, virtual machines, cloud services, web sites, data services, IOT, etc.
  • Lead technical deployments that involve multiple IT teams and stakeholders
  • Provide technical direction to meet the internal needs
  • Develop, enhance, orchestration and automation of cloud enablement tools
  • Design a highly scalable and redundant virtual infrastructure to support the company's future growth
  • Provide innovative suggestions for complex implementation solutions
  • Create documentation and implementation plans to allow support teams to build and manage the internal cloud environment
  • Stay abreast of current technologies and make recommendations based on knowledge and research

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of Azure experience designing and supporting large scale environments
  • 5+ years of hands on experience supporting Enterprise computing infrastructure and virtualization computing technologies
  • Solid architecture & design experience in using virtualization technologies
  • Established experience with automated, elastic scaling of cloud services, automated deployment and remediation
  • Ability to prioritize projects and deliverables
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively as well as independently to support deadlines
  • Demonstrate ability to use problem solving techniques such as root cause analysis to resolve issues
  • Demonstrate ability to write and present effective materials, including presentations, status reporting, technical diagrams and flowcharts
  • Ability to follow and adhere to policies, procedures and standards relating to network and systems management
  • Prepare detailed build/test plans to implement new technologies and configurations
  • Ability to collaborate with a team working across multiple locations

    Preferred Qualifications

  • Azure Certification is strongly preferred
  • A track record of success developing and deploying creative technical solutions to business problems for or within large enterprise organizations
  • Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field
  • Experience with the design and development of cloud-native, secure, distributed applications
  • Knowledge with modern service hosting, security, and risk management concerns such as IAM, access control, monitoring, IaaS/PaaS/SaaS, and containers
  • Knowledge of infrastructure automation through DevOps scripting and configuration management
  • Working knowledge of designing high availability systems in the cloud (fault domains, availability zones, deployment slots, regions)
  • Experience developing ARM Templates, Cloud formation templates, or Terraform
  • Networking fundamentals, including VPN, security, and WAN concepts
  • Experience using Source Control (GIt, TFVC, etc.)
  • Experience with infrastructure Configuration tools (DSC, Puppet or Chef)
  • Knowledge of Cloud Database fundamentals (Azure SQL, MS SQL)
  • Experience working in an agile continuous delivery workflow & team
  • Experience communicating technical complexity and change to a broad spectrum of stakeholders
  • Experience with technical writing and documentation

Scheduled Weekly Hours

40

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: IT Recruitment
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time +/- 4 hours

servicenow

Job description

A-Line Staffing is seeking a qualified candidate for the position of Remote ServiceNow Developer

Please review the desired qualifications listed below and apply or contact Nate Namiotka with questions.

Requirements:

  • Preference for Admins with a wide range of experience with ITSM, ITBM, ITOM development and implementation of ServiceNow applications including but not limited to - Incident Management, Problem Management, Configuration Management, Change Management, Release Management, Knowledge Management, Discovery, Asset Management, Demand Management, Resource Management, Project & Portfolio Management, Time Tracking, Agile (Enhancement/Defect), Service Portal, Performance Analytics

  • 2 or more years’ experience

I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Nate Namiotka – A-Line Staffing

Apply now

Benefits

  • Health Insurance
  • 401K
  • Long term Contract

items.content:
The Data and Analytics team is part of my clients Consultancy function, which has over 65 practitioners. The function helps clients with all aspects of Data Management from developing their data strategy, through to designing and implementing data-centric solutions to deliver the strategy.

The projects are varied and include:

  • Defining a client's Analytics Strategy
  • Developing baseline, target and transitional Analytics architectures
  • Preforming gap analyses, maturity assessments and developing Analytics technology roadmaps
  • Analytics technology assessment and selection
  • Designing and implementing Data Warehouses/ Analytics Solutions
  • Designing and implementing data integration and data quality solutions
  • Supporting the development of client bids and presentations of proposals

Key Responsibilities for the Azure BI and Data Architect role

  • Work independently or as part of a team to translate business needs into the design of Azure BI/analytics solution architectures for external clients, and internal product teams
  • Work as part of a team to develop the overall solution architecture for BI/analytics and data-centric business solutions and industry focused propositions
  • Provide technical leadership and mentoring for Azure BI/Analytics teams, defining standards and practices
  • Assist with estimating and planning for projects and bids
  • Undertake Azure BI and Analytics technology options appraisals
  • Undertake project lead architect role for projects confined to Azure analytics products
  • Participate in business development providing technical input and meeting with clients to secure new business
  • Design and develop proof of concepts and deliver client demonstrations

Essential Skills

  • Experience of designing solution architectures comprising Azure data and analytics cloud services, for hybrid and cloud based analytics solutions
  • Experience of delivering data ingestion, pipelines, quality and integration services within hybrid and Azure cloud based deployments
  • Experience of delivering data and semantic models for data warehouses, data marts and other analytical stores

Desirable Skills

  • Experience of delivering Advanced Analytics Azure based solutions, including deploying machine learning models for batch or real-time scoring
  • Experience of delivering reporting and data visualisation services and solutions
  • Experience of delivering real time data integration e.g. streaming (IoT) and APIs
  • Experience of Agile project methodologies
  • Experience of Power BI report and query design

Person specification

  • Degree level or equivalent
  • Ability to articulate and present different points-of-views on various technologies
  • Experience of SDLC processes and methodologies
  • Experience of complex integration issues and technologies
  • Highly customer focused, able to quickly build trust and develop customer intimacy
  • Solution-oriented with the imagination to identify work-arounds for critical problems
  • Good interpersonal skills with the ability to guide, direct, motivate and support staff either directly or indirectly
  • Effective time management and an ability to recognise and respond to changing priorities and requirements
  • Flexible with regard to travel
  • Experience of working within the consulting industry is desirable
  • Microsoft BI (Business Intelligence) certifications
  • TOGAF Certification

items.content: Position OverviewThis role is for a DevOps engineer that understands the DevOps mindset and can help shape and develop infrastructure and full lifecycle, automated, product delivery solutions. You will be utilizing your knowledge and experience in software development, systems administration, development operations, performance monitoring / reporting, and Agile to build high-performance, scalable solutions for our customers. You will be supporting DevOps initiatives and developing systems and software to create automated build environments, and full Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment solutions. Understanding configuration management and infrastructure as code are key to the success of this role. You will understand and work well in Agile environments and have hands on experience with DevOps and full lifecycle ALM tools, including administration, configuration, development and deployment. You will represent Go2Group as a Subject Matter Expert and guide our customers to success. Position RequirementsBS in Computer Science, IT, Engineering or equivalent experience.3-5 years of experience as a software or DevOps engineer, with experience in Linux and Windows administration.Experience with Cloudbees Jenkins, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Docker, Kubernetes, Linux, Ansible Position ResponsibilitiesBe the technical face of Go2Group to our customers and serve as a lead to guide development teams to automation and Continuous Deployment.Develop, configure and administer DevOps and ALM solutions.Systems administration of Linux and Windows based environments.Evaluation and integration of IT systems and development tools, and replace where needed.Identify and address system performance bottlenecks in high availability environments.Perform configuration management duties and develop infrastructure automation code.Evangelize best practice DevOps and Agile within the broader organization.Provide technical support to developers around tool usage and build environments.Provide guidance to establish and implement build methodologies.Create and maintain build automation and deployment code for production environments.Integrate software tool-chain into a Continuous Integration environment. Required Skills / Experience:Must have a strong customer focus, and is capable of technical deep-dives into servers, databases, load balancers, operating systems, networks, build automation and related code.Self-starter, independent thinker.Ability to work in a collaborative team environment or independently as needed.A background in software development with a diverse range of experience including coding, test automation, managing and configuring databases (both relational and non-relational), and system administration.Hands on system administration experience with Linux, Windows Servers, Apache, IIS, MS SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle.Hands on experience with the following or related technologies: Bitbucket, Bamboo, Git, Subversion, Crucible, Jenkins, Nexus, Artifactory, Ansible, Puppet, Chef, Docker, Kubernetes, Vagrant, JIRA, TeamCity.Hands on experience administering Altassian products (Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo, Fisheye/Crucible, etc.)Hands on experience with scripting (perl, bash, python) and software development (Java, Node JS, Angular).Experience with Atlassian plugin development.Experience with public cloud providers such as AWS, Azure, GCP, and related cloud architectures. Preferred Skills / Experience:Atlassian CertificationsAWS CertificationsCloud Bees Certifications

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=5, dotnet=5, c=22, mobile=10, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=3, java=4, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Primary Responsibilities include:

* Design and develop in AWS, Azure and GCP Clouds, delivering enterprise level shared services for the management of public cloud end points and services

* Translate cloud native API commands to ServiceNow or other tooling formats

* Work with functional and admin teams to deliver automated workflow solutions with cloud native tools and ServiceNow

* Advanced scripting of business rules, UI Policies, Client Scripts, ACLs, Workflow Activities, etc.

* Facilitate and support the rollout of code through all levels of the SDLC

* Advise functional and admin teams on design, development and overall best practices.

* React quickly to ever changing market conditions and technology advancements with out of the box solutions that allow our business partners to have the tools that will enable them to reach and exceed our sales goals

* Manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables

* Work closely with architects and portfolio managers to execute product/services automation/product roadmaps

Qualifications

* 5+ years of software development experience

* 5+ years of cloud developer experience with AWS, Azure and GCP

* 3+ years of experience working as a developer in Agile/Scrum teams

* BS degree in Computer Science, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience

* Experience working with and managing work with Jira and/or Aha! Experience is a plus

* Extensive experience with Cloud APIs covering software defined Compute, Networking and storage technologies as well as Cloud native automation tools

* Familiarity with ServiceNow ITIL/ITOM a plus

* Proven and verifiable history of analyzing business situations and working within a group environment to provide efficient and effective software solutions

* Participation in the full software development life cycle: Analysis, Design, Coding, Testing and promotion into Production

* Strong web services experience (REST and SOA architectures)

* Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment

* Experience with one or more general purpose programming languages including but not limited to: Java, Java Script, Go, Python, Perl, C/C++, C# and Objective C

* Strong working knowledge designing, developing and deploying IaaS and n-tier application hosting on AWS, Azure and GCP

* Knowledge of system design and development used within Service Oriented Architecture and web services integration (SOAP, WSDL, JAXWS)

* Proven history of providing technical support during all phases of project delivery. This includes, but is not limited to: development of project estimates, solution design review, documentation creation and review, and peer code reviews

* Demonstrated experience with service integration using LDAP, MS Active Directory, ADFS, Single Sign-on and web services

* Experience working with four or more from the following: infrastructure as a service platforms, platform as a service, service management, web application development, Unix/Linux environments, mobile application development, distributed and parallel systems, machine learning, information retrieval, natural language processing, networking, developing large software systems, and/or security software development.

* Experience with enterprise ServiceNow implementations

* Must be adaptable to work in a varied, fast paced exciting, ever changing environment

* Strong core knowledge of ITIL processes

* Good analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve technical issues

* Self-starter with desire to understand work and project objectives

* Excellent organizational, analytical, written and oral communications skills

* Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to use those skills to effectively Interface with end users and development teams to conduct systems analysis and planning

* Experience with Kubernetes architecture and tools (Helm/Istio) a plus

* Experience with Microservice development hosted on Kubernetes a plus

- provided by Dice

tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)

items.content:
Role: Lead Engineer / Solutions Architect 


 


Employer: www.lex.lawyer


Location: peckhamlevels.org (with some home working)


Type: full time permanent


Pay: £70-100k+ depending on experience





From the team that brought you www.monacosolicitors.co.uk and www.monacodigital.co.uk, we're now building a groundbreaking legal app called Lex which is intended to open up legal services & access to justice to the average person, globally. We need a senior developer and we’ve made a video for the role here.


The concept of the app is to give people video calls with a lawyer at the press of a button, to deal with their problems like employment, matrimonial, tax and property. Most people have never used a lawyer (other than perhaps for conveyancing) and we want to change that. It is similar to the Babylon health app but for lawyers instead of doctors. 


 


70This is a fantastic opportunity to make a difference and work with a dynamic and forward thinking startup team. We encourage teamwork and open discussion, especially for problem solving, and we have a real passion for bringing the provision of legal services up to date using tech. In fact, Monaco Solicitors was recently shortlisted in the Law Society Excellence Awards for innovation in technology.


 


The product team currently consists of 1 front end dev and 2 designers plus a product owner. To give you a little sneak peek of what you will be building, our app will feature the following:


 


Account creation (both Lawyers and clients)



  • Lawyer and user profiles

  • Calendar booking system with availability

  • Cloud stored documents/paperwork

  • Provision of advice from Lawyer in paid sessions, including video call

  • Payment gateway


 


Skills Required



  • Building React & React Native apps 

  • Building PWA (progressive web apps)

  • Javascript, ES6+

  • NodeJs (AWS lambda / serverless)

  • Minimum 6-8 years of Experience in creating Web & Apps solutions

  • IT infrastructure and cloud development

  • Software architecture design

  • DevOps

  • Project and product management


 


Responsibilities



  • Coding (minimum 50% of the role)

  • Analysing requirements and coming up with appropriate solutions

  • Setting up the workflow for devs 

  • Guiding and participating in stack selection

  • Project management, agile / scrum 


 


Nice to have



  • AWS ecosystem experience


 


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Pension scheme

  • Opportunity to work from home 

  • Unique office space (converted multi-storey car park in Peckham

items.title: Cloud Solutions Architect – Storage, Backup, Replication
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Cloud Solutions Architect – Storage, Backup, Replication

United Kingdom, Glasgow
Company: RECRUITMENTREVOLUTION.COM

Overview

Cloud Solutions Architect – Storage, Backup, Replication, Hyper Cloud Services | Top 3 Cloud Solutions Leader
Glasgow
£55,000 – £75,000 + Excellent Company Benefits Package + Personal Development

Ready to join one of the leading UK providers of cloud computing and managed hosting?

We are one of the leading providers of cloud computing and managed hosting. Headquartered in Glasgow, we employ over 400 talented staff in offices and datacentres across the UK. Originally founded in 1998, we are listed on the London Stock Exchange and specialise in delivering cloud consultancy, facilitation and digital transformation to ISVs, SMEs, enterprises and the UK public sector.

Our employees help enable any size of business and organisation to operate their online data and IT environments safely and securely. Our technical staff are experts in public, private and hybrid cloud solutions – including AWS and Microsoft Azure – as well as data centre and network engineering. We own and operate a network of UK data centres connected by a high capacity private fibre network and backed by 24/7 technical support.

The Cloud Solutions Architect Role:

This role will suit you if you love Technology and want to be in a business where you are using cutting edge tools and delivering best of breed solutions for hosted environments. You’ll not be scared of AWS or Azure and will have a strong background in Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS).

Key Duties and Responsibilities:

+ As a Solutions Architect, you are required to work closely with the sales function to assist in client requirements capture, solution design, solution pricing and presentation along with the creation and preparation of documentation to support the sales proposal and contract process
+ You will work with the Technical Services Director to assist with the identification of products and services which would serve to develop our portfolio of managed services products
+ You will work to gain skills relevant to your position with specific emphasis on Storage, Backup, Replication and Hyper Cloud Services

Your Knowledge, Skills and Experience:

Essential

+ Server and Storage Family, EMC Software and Storage Solutions or equivalent technologies from other vendors
+ Working knowledge of Hyper Cloud providers such as AWS and Azure
+ Working knowledge of the Managed Service Provider (MSP) market, related products and its dynamics
+ Excellent operational delivery skills
+ Project management experience

Desirable

+ Experience of technical pre-sales in the MSP sector
+ Expertise in server hardware and software, Cisco networking and security technology, Linux and Windows environments and the design of best of breed IaaS solutions
+ Experience in attaining industry compliance standards

What do we offer in return?

+ Exposure and access to cutting-edge technology as well as the opportunity to work alongside like-minded technical enthusiasts
+ Holiday Trading Scheme – buy or sell part of your annual leave allowance
+ Travel Loans – unsecured interest free travel loans to assist employees
+ ShareSave/SAYE – buy shares in the company at a discounted rate
+ ½ Day off on your Birthday
+ Long service benefits – additional annual leave and access to private healthcare
+ Snacks, drinks and fruit all day every day
+ Breakfast on us every day including a hot roll on Fridays
+ We’ll shout you to lunch once a month
+ Supported training

Training & Development

As you can gather, we have a relaxed and friendly working environment where you will be working with some of the country’s best talent and greatest technical experts. We want our people to thrive, prosper and to leave work every day feeling valued and that they have made a difference. Talented, motivated and creative people lie at the heart of our success so we invest heavily in our people by encouraging and supporting them to gain and maintain professional and vendor certifications. All of our staff are supported, through training and coaching, to learn our systems and processes enabling them to become a valuable member of the team quickly.

Interested? Apply here for a fast-track path to the Hiring Manager

Application notice… We take your privacy seriously. When you apply, we shall process your details and pass your application to our client for review for this vacancy only. As you might expect we may contact you by email, text or telephone. Your data is processed on the basis of our legitimate interests in fulfilling the recruitment process. Please refer to our Data Privacy Policy & Notice on our website for further details.

If you have any pre-application questions please contact us first quoting the job title & ref. Good luck, Team RR.

Apply for job

items.content:
Remote Cloud Architect - Build & Learn in the Financial Industry

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Financial Services
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Scratch Financial Inc. | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) Lisbon +/- 4 hours

Technologies

kubernetes
google-cloud-platform
automation
architecture
continuous-delivery

Job description

What we're building

Scratchpay provides pet parents with simple friendly payment plans. We help pet parents to provide the care their pets need, easing the financial barrier. We are growing fast in the veterinary space and Veterinarian, Pet owners and pets across the US and Canada love us! Come help us help more pets!

About the position

This position is about helping to build Scratchpay's Cloud Infrastructure. It is about providing pet parents and clinics with the payment solution they need and working really hard in the background to protect their data, without them even worrying about it. It's about giving the business what it needs to grow safely, smoothly, and with as little surprises as possible when it comes to data and cybersecurity.

It's also about working with the engineering, security, data and operational teams to research, design, implement, deploy and maintain the best tools and practices there are to achieve our goal and mission and educate all teams to make the best of it.

This is about pushing the edge of what has been done in Finance and Lending to build a scalable platform that can serve all-the-pets, however many (but the more the merrier). This is about working with a brilliant team that's been growing from 0 to 1 in ~3 years and that is helping pets in all states in the US and most provinces in Canada.

This job is for you if you recognize yourself in this:

  • I am a good mind
  • I can think for myself
  • I am critical of myself and others
  • I am always respectful
  • I ask questions when needed
  • I can understand the boundaries but have a lot of fun within them
  • I take my work seriously and never let people down
  • I work hard because I want to deliver the best that I can
  • I always observe and reflect on how to do better tomorrow
  • I like animals
  • I want everyone to be and feel safe

About you

Ideal Location: Europe (Portugal / Mid/Eastern Europe)

Ideal Experience: 3-5+ years

Ideal Background: You have ideally worked in a highly scalable environment, a modern Financial institution is preferred, or a cloud-first, customer and cyber-security centric venture.

Requirements

  • Extensive experience in Cloud architecture and Cloud design across multiple cloud platforms in a large scale environment;
  • Cloud and automation engineering experience in a mission-critical environment;
  • Ability to design, implement and document architectures and solutions using a mix of IaaS / PaaS / SaaS, DevOps and with a strong focus on automation, internal compliance, monitoring, documentation and cyber-security;
  • Strong experience and understanding of GCP and automation within GCP;
  • Must be able to design serverless architecture and create automated deployments across the CI/CD stack;
  • Deep technical knowledge in Ansible or other automation tools such as Terraform;
  • Proficient in Bash one or more scripting languages such as Python, NodeJS, Golang;
  • Strong skills and experience through the CI/CD stack with infrastructure elements such as Kubernetes;
  • Experience with Web Services (RESTful, REST, APIs, API Gateways);
  • A strong knowledge and understanding of data migration practices and technologies;
  • A strong understanding of NoSQL, RDBMS, Graph DB, KV and column store

You will:

  • Work with teams to collaboratively design, implement, ensure compliance on and deploy services and infrastructure changes for Scratch teams
  • Work with the Cyber Security team (purple) to audit, monitor and ensure that the infrastructure is compliant with all internal policies and help the red team confirm it via a systematic penetration testing
  • Perform regular maintenance and security audits following internal calendar of patch management, service updates, infrastructure configuration review
  • Review the findings with the Cyber Security team and immediately escalate items that require attention to the Security Committee to collaborate on an immediate resolution plan 
  • Work with the Cyber Security Purple team to improve and review monitoring and findings
  • Maintain, scale and deploy new Kubernetes clusters as needed by the infrastructure
  • Build and maintain the documentation and SOPs in collaboration with the Cyber Security team so we can always validate internal compliance against them
  • Maintain, test and develop Scratch' disaster recovery and data loss prevention plans in collaboration with other teams
  • Support the Data team in building, deploying and securing data warehouses and data pipelines
  • Support the Engineering team in designing the best solutions to support Scratch growth and evolution of design patterns used at Scratch by providing the supporting infrastructure and options to get the work done with optimal operational efficiency and highest security

How to know if you are a good fit?

Ideal Competencies

Legend:

  • + = desirable
  • ++ = strongly desirable
  • ! = required
  • !! = strongly required

Competencies

  • Operational Strength
    • Accuracy (!!)
    • Devotion to quality (!!)
    • Planning (!)
    • Presenting (+)
  • Interpersonal Strength
    • Adaptability (!)
    • Cooperation (!!)
    • Creating Support (++)
    • Listening Skills (+)
    • Providing Feedback (!)
    • Social Skills (+)
  • Personal Strength
    • Assertiveness (++)
    • Drive (!)
    • Flexibility (!)
    • Initiative (!!)
    • Integrity (!!)
    • Personal Development (!)
    • Willingness to change (!)
  • Conceptual Strength
    • Analyzing and forming opinions (!!)
    • Helicopter View (!)
    • Innovating (++)
    • Situational Awareness (!)
    • Strategic Insight (++)

In other words, you will have to:

  • Have empathy;
  • Understand the position of others. It is critical to navigate through communication, mitigation and culture
  • Be independent;
  • Know when to raise a point or ask for clarification or escalate a potential issue
  • Communicate with respect but assertiveness;
  • Speak your mind and expect others to. Engage in respectful and mindful conflict. Quality > quantity;
  • Know your stuff and know what you don't know;
  • Understand that no one is perfect but everyone can learn if they chose so. Be humble enough to know your weaknesses. Be open-minded and hard-working enough to be able to fix them;
  • Take constructive criticism;
  • Ask yourself "how to know if I'm wrong?". You may not, but not challenging your thinking is unhealthy. We challenge each others a lot @Scratchpay;

Our culture

We care about the human aspect of work and we expect others to. Excellence is also an important keyword @ Scratchpay. While everyone makes mistakes, we learn from them. We are conscious about efficiency and effectiveness in a positive way. We don't do things that bring low-to-no value short or long term. We also do hard things that bring a lot of value. Quality, attention to detail and respect are some of the traits you must have and expect others to have.

The good

  • We are a team of dedicated, hard-working, friendly individuals
  • We move fast, sometimes break things with measure, we give a second chance
  • We give constructive feedback, we challenge each other
  • We are open-minded and we care for each other
  • Everyone is striving towards excellence. Mediocrity isn't our cup of tea. But we always work hard to help those that are willing to get there!

The bad

  • Everything goes fast and the ultimate goal is to move the business fast. There can be disconnects in communication at times. We all need to navigate through this and push whenever it is critical to do so.
  • We are open-minded but things need to be moving forward.
  • We say what we have to. So expect to hear some unpleasant - but true - things sometimes. Don't hesitate to argue back - with respect - if you disagree.
  • Like any startup, It can be a mess some days. You also will likely have to do things that aren't in your scope sometimes. Part of the fun, right? ;)

The most important thing is: We are always looking at improving. All the time, step by step. If you feel mediocre and don't see a path to improvement or can't listen to others' voices to, please do not apply.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Strong hardware
  • Ample holidays
  • Stock Options
  • A really cool team

items.content:
Description

SAIC is hiring for an Azure or Azure Stack Cloud Solutions Architect to join and contribute to the Private Cloud team. This position is a combination of IT architecture and automation roles.

The Cloud department provides public and private cloud services, automation services, and tools to enable self service delivery of IT using the DevOps framework. This department will constantly evolve to meet the rapid pace of cloud innovation.



The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Performs the full lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing, implementation, integration and maintenance) of the current Azure Stack cloud as well as contribute with architecture, procurement, deployment, production, and administration of additional scale units, availability zones, and disconnected deployments of Azure Stack.
  • Maintains the integrity of the stack and underlying systems and resource providers.
  • Build and maintain terraform Infrastructure as Code packages for cloud deployments. Build and maintain custom ARM templates.
  • Build and maintained CI/CD pipelines for IaaS deployments including such architectures as basic two-tier configurations to multi-node Horton Works Data Platform clusters.
  • Build Ansible playbooks for controlled IaaS systems.
  • Build complex powershell scripts to automate any number of configurations and scenarios.

The selected candidate must be able to solve new and complex problems involving the integration of a wide variety of technologies including servers, storage, networking, software, middleware and all systems supporting the private cloud environments. The selected candidate can work at a remote location but will be required to travel to Albuquerque throughout the year.


DISL

ABQS







Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Requires bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or information systems and 5 years of relevant work experience OR 9 years of relevant work experience in lieu of degree; Or Master's degree and 3 years of relevant work experience; OR PhD and no related experience.
  • Excellent communication and teaming skills.
  • Ability to obtain, and maintain, a DOE security clearance
  • Minimum of 2 years using one of the following technologies:
    • Azure
    • Azure Stack
    • AWS
    • Ansible
    • Terraform



Desired Skills

  • Experience building Azure Arm Templates
  • Experience building terraform packages
  • Experience with Gitlab Ci/CD
  • Windows Systems Administration (Windows 2012R2, 2016, 2019)
  • Linux Systems Administration (Ubuntu, RHEL)
  • Advanced PowerShell scripting
  • Microsoft Azure Certifications



Desired Qualifications



Job Posting Date: 2019-08-:21:32 UTC

Primary Location: ALBUQUERQUE, NM 87123 US

Clearance Level Must Currently Possess: None

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOE Q

Potential for Teleworking: No

Travel: No

Shift: Day Job

Schedule:
SAIC is a premier technology integrator, solving our nation's most complex modernization and systems engineering challenges across the defense, space, federal civilian, and intelligence markets. Our robust portfolio of offerings includes high-end solutions in systems engineering and integration; enterprise IT, including cloud services; cyber; software; advanced analytics and simulation; and training. We are a team of 23,000 strong driven by mission, united purpose, and inspired by opportunity. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has annual revenues of approximately $6.5 billion. For more information, visit saic.com. For information on the benefits SAIC offers, see Working at SAIC . EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability
- provided by Dice

items.content:
Kubernetes Solutions Engineer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Giant Swarm GmbH | Cologne, Germany

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Cologne, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

kubernetes
containers
microservices

Job description

We are looking for a Kubernetes Solution Architect

You are the voice of the customer inside Giant Swarm and the voice of Giant Swarm towards the customers, helping both sides to be successful.

Your Job:

  • You work closely with customers to understand their architecture and further their understanding of Giant Swarm, helping them to get the most out of our product and the CNCF landscape, master Cloud Native tools like Kubernetes, Prometheus as well as Loki, Helm and others.
  • Our solution architects are becoming part of diverse open source communities around tools that our customers need and use, contributing back to those projects where possible. You build and maintain helm charts that might start out as a special project for one customer and end up being a managed service run by all our customers.
  • You hold trainings and workshops at conferences, for our existing customers, as well as with Giant Swarm’s potential customers. .  Do note that the role requires minimum travel as most of our interactions as a fully remote company are via video conferencing.

  • Learn from customer's problems with moving to microservices architectures, get your hands dirty and find out what Cloud Native project's entrails look like. The more successful our customers are with the Cloud Native journey, the more successful we are.
  • Ultimately, you are also responsible for documentation, helping the product teams implement fixes, prioritizing features and making sure we only need to answer questions once.

  • First impressions are important! You help create a great onboarding experience for our customers and become the main point of contact for them.
  • To sum it up: Customer Success is all that matters. Within the solution engineering team, we make sure our customers are happy and taking the right steps going forward, at best you anticipate the problems they might face in the future.

Requirements:

  • You have experience with more than one programming language, including Go, and a strong architectural background.
  • You feel at home in the Kubernetes world, especially the multitude of Open Source tools around Kubernetes and the Container World.
  • You can explain complicated things concisely and easily for a diverse audience.
  • You have a strong sense in providing an awesome customer service that makes life easier for Developers. Your communication skills (especially written form) are excellent. Very good English skills are a must-have. German skills are a bonus.
  • You are open to attend conferences with our team and hold talks in front of customers. You are happy to travel 5-10% per year
  • We (and our customers) are currently mostly distributed around Europe (around UTC), thus, your main timezone should be somewhere between -2UTC to +2UTC to ensure better communication.

Why we think this position is worth applying for (challenge us!)

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are a growing team (from 15+ European countries) and every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things like in the guidebook. Hell, our customers choose us because we are building how the guidebook should look in this day and age. You can try things out.
  • We play a key role in our customer's digital transformation. We have partnered up with Amazon Web Services and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow.
  • We serve some of Europe's leading organisations and are talking to many more.

About Giant Swarm GmbH

What is it like to work at Giant Swarm?

We would like to give you a glimpse on how working with Giant Swarm (we are a fully remote team) is like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever (some of us travel almost half the year and work from remote islands) and whenever you want (keeping in mind that there are some meetings we would like you to attend). We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. If you take up a task, own it. If you see a problem, solve it.

Teamwork

We are a growing company with team members distributed all over Europe and plans on expanding to the US. Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realise you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, your choice to work at home or in a coworking space, flexible hours, minimal meetings, transparent communication, etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must.

We don't hire job descriptions. We hire humans. :)

We welcome applications from everybody, regardless ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.

Interested? Questions? Contact Larissa or apply directly.

Apply now

Benefits

  • unlimited holidays
  • fair and transparent open salaries
  • familiy friendlyness is a must
  • choose the time you want to work
  • choose the devices you want to work with
  • remote work possible

items.title: Developer Advocate at YLD
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Developer Advocate

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Agile Software Development, Software Development / Engineering, Technology Consulting
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: YLD | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London

Technologies

open-source
javascript
devops
testing

Job description

Overview

Everything we do empowers our clients to move forward.

Great technology companies are built on incredible design, engineering and strategy, working in unison, operating at the very heart of an organisation and its audience. Enabling organisations to become great technology companies is our mission and our promise to our clients.

We aim to leave them with the mindset, tools, skills and expertise they need to go beyond their own expectations, revolutionise their sectors, and for us to be proud of the change we create with them and their customers.

About YLD

“Good enough to be dangerous”

During our company-wide trip to Porto, our CEO Nuno attributed YLD’s continued growth and success down to those we hire.

Our employees are “good enough to be dangerous” and we believe that bringing extraordinary people together produces great results.

We are a strong proponent of continuous delivery and rigorous testing practices, and we help our customers move towards modern best-practices with minimal risk.

We educate, co-develop and automate, whilst passing on our expertise to our customers’ development teams in the process. It’s not just about lines of code.

YLD has offices in London, Manchester, Lisbon, Porto.

About The Role

A YLD Developer Advocate is first and foremost an engineer, so you will need to be specialised on a particular technology. You will also have experience engaging with the community, public speaking and developer relations.

Our tech conferences and meetups are built by the community, for the community. Your role will be leading the innovation of our community engagement with open-source work. We expect a Developer Advocate to work closely with the CTO and Head of Marketing to engage open source communities and tell the YLD story.

This role helps keep us connected to the communities that love technology as much as we do!

About You

You will act as a passionate advocate within the community as well as being a vocal champion for developer interests within YLD.  

You will be an engineer that loves to connect with developers - you enjoy speaking publicly about open-source technologies at conferences, meetups and sharing your knowledge through varying content forms. 

You’ll bring an entrepreneurial flair,  as you will build and maintain networks with other engineers and decision-making leaders.  

You possess excellent communication skills that will allow you to build clear and compelling presentations and deliver them to a variety of audiences. 

Your Responsibilities

Engineering

  • Open Source work - Be active in the open source world, own open source projects that impact the community and participate in relevant open source projects by opening issues, commenting on existing issues, submitting pull requests, etc;
  • Software Development - Build tooling / extensions for the technologies we use, find ways to improve the engineers’ workflows and talk / write about it;
  • Research - Proactively seeking new technologies, building prototypes, and writing about the experience, which will inform YLD of potential new business areas  to explore;
  • Training - Be a leader and an expert in a given technology, write content that can be used in a business context for a client or internally for our engineers to help their professional growth;
  • Sales Engineering - Being able to clearly articulate the benefits of a particular technology in the context of a client engagement, provide workshops to clients and be able to prove to clients the value of using a given technology

Marketing / Community

  • Community engagement - Work closely with the marketing team to represent YLD within our community via education such as talks or workshops at conferences and meetups, events organisation, and content creation;
  • Knowledge sharing - Lead content creation on the core YLD technologies via blogs, white papers, webinars, videos as well as exploring new channels and technologies;
  • Documentation - Work on training materials and identifying ways to document how we utilise open-source technologies;
  • Educating the internal teams - Bring back the knowledge from the industry and community events by presenting new trends and working with the team to implement new ways of working and community engagement

Our Offer

  • 6 month pay reviews
  • 6 months fully paid maternity and paternity leave
  • £2,000 yearly allowance for training / conferences
  • £300 hardware budget
  • Minimum of 25 days holiday (excluding Public Holidays)
  • Mentorship through fortnightly 1:1s
  • Company pension
  • Private health care
  • Company Uber and Airbnb account for business travel
  • Cycle to work scheme

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Flexible hours
  • Minimum of 25 days holiday
  • 6 months fully paid Maternity / Paternity leave
  • Free lunch on Fridays / weekly Retro
  • Opportunity to attend / speak at multiple events
  • £2000 yearly training and conference allowance
  • Fun, challenging and rewarding work environment
  • Possibility to travel! (Annual company trip)
  • Medical insurance (Bupa)
  • Offices in London, Lisbon, Porto and Manchester

items.content:
Magnolia Solution Architect (German-Speaking)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer, Full Stack Developer
Industry: Agile Software Development, Enterprise Software, Marketing Software
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Magnolia International Ltd. | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin

Technologies

java
glassfish
unix
jboss
http

Job description

“We believe in making it as easy and fast as possible for smart, digitally experienced brands to deliver great web projects and amazing customer experiences…and we love doing it!” Tim Brown, CEO, Magnolia

Sounds like you? Great, here’s how Magnolia empowers your success:

  • A Great Product:  Loved by clients and respected by analysts, Magnolia is arguably one of the best CMS solutions on the market.
  • Directly Contribute to Magnolia’s Success: We value each individuals’ input and create opportunities to realize them.
  • Great variety in your areas of responsibility: You will be able to dive into any skill area within the company that allows you to grow according to your personal career goals.
  • International Exposure: With offices in the USA, Spain, Switzerland, Czech Republic, Singapore, and Vietnam you will collaborate with colleagues from over 30 Nationalities.



Now, if you are an experienced Solution Architect who wants to support our business growth in the DACH region, please read on.

 What we need you to do

  • Provide value during product demonstrations by showcasing Magnolia features and capabilities during initial product evaluations.
  • Define requirements and develop measurement strategies to ensure the Magnolia solution addresses the customers’ specific business needs. 
  • Provide expert know-how on development, integration and Magnolia deployment and system architecture, including backup strategies, load balancing, failover, security, multisite and general hosting configuration.
  • Consult with existing clients to expand their usage of Magnolia or troubleshoot issues encountered.
  • Build proof of concept and new modules, trace issues in client implementations and propose solutions to maximize the business value to our customers.
  • Work constantly with cutting-edge technology to help customers to reach their demanding goals in the area of digital transformation.

What you ideally offer

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field is required
  • Fluent in German (at least C1)
  • +5 years of experience in software development, building or managing the development of a complex, commercial enterprise-class product. Experience with cloud-based installations and web services is a big plus.
  • Proficiency with web development skills
  • Proven software engineering skills in Java.
  • Experience with a broad range of operating systems, application servers, databases, and related products (e.g. Unix, Solaris, OSX, Windows; WebSphere, WebLogic, Glassfish, Tomcat, JBoss; Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server etc.).
  • Experience in Internet technologies: HTTP, HTML, XML, Web server, server-side Java, and databases.
  • Excellent problem solving and communication skills.
  • A strong commitment to timelines and deliverables.
  • Willing and able to travel regularly within Europe.
  • A collaborative can-do attitude and a relentless focus on helping our customers succeed.
Apply now

About Magnolia International Ltd.

Why work at Magnolia

Magnolia is an exciting place to work, where good team dynamics are valued and where you will be encouraged to pursue your own growth. Get to know us better by browsing our employee blog or checking our current job openings.

We develop the best web content management system, an interesting, high-quality product, have big customers, work with friendly people in a relaxed environment, and be well compensated - that's what developing at Magnolia is about

Get the insider view of working at Magnolia here.

Our product blurb:
Magnolia CMS delivers smartphone simplicity, on an enterprise scale. The mobile-inspired user interface works through customizable, task-focused Apps, a notification stream called the Pulse, and a system of Favorites for quickly accessing the workspace.
Magnolia is used in more than 100 countries across the world, by governments and leading FORTUNE 500 enterprises.

If you want to see more of how we spend our time as Magnolians, both in the office and on outings, check out our albums on Flickr.

Benefits

  • We love Apple - you get what you need
  • Competitive compensation
  • 25 days paid vacation
  • Freedom and responsibility in your work
  • Low admin bureaucracy in a self driven environment
  • Endless snacks, catering, free drinks, happy hours, BBQs etc...
  • Responsible self-management
  • Home- / Remote friendly company
  • No dress code, relaxed atmosphere
